UOL SAC: responsive activation

Thinking in the user experience, our CEO asked us to turn off the SAC's responsiveness for a while, at least until the old pages could be shooted down.

But it wasn't so simple, there was more then five hundred pages to shut down, so our team created something called wrapper, to embed old pages into Angular Apps via iFrames.

Main challenges:

  • UOL SAC is adaptive, not responsive, so, hard coded container's widths was totally useless to disable responsivity.
  • We had to integrate more than 500 old HTML1 pages into the app via wrapper, an iFrame with super powers
  • To adapt the browser viewport dinamicly to support old pages width inside the wrapper
  • To see in the middle of the project that i.e. unique visitors number decreased enough to cancel support for old browsers
  • To refactor a lot of unit tests, that broken with Wrapper concept and i.e. 8 support kill
  • Be the first team in UOL to use and evolve it's brand new Custom Bootstrap
  • To discover that Native Bootstrap do not support Angular and learn Angular UI from the scratch.
